summary: In this context, 'nitrate' and 'Nitrate' refer to the same chemical compound, emphasizing its role in the synthesis of nitric oxide (NO) through a pathway involving oral bacteria. The text highlights dietary nitrate as a significant source of NO, which has implications for health, particularly in terms of hypotensive effects and increased blood NO metabolites. The mention of nitrate-rich vegetables underscores its importance in nutrition and physiology.
